{"title":"page 21","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"21
Sec. S. They shall every morning, (Sundays
excepted,) unless otherwise directed by the Mayor
or Chief of Police, cause the prisoners who may
have been detained at the Police Station Houses
the night previous, and all property which may
have come into his possession during said time, to
be conveyed to the Recorder's Court of his District, accompanied by the policemen who may be
witnesses, and he shall at the same time take or
.transmit to said Recorder or Presiding Magistrate
reports which shall be exact copies of the entries
he is required to make by Sections 11 and 12 of
this Article.
Sec. 9. They shall take or transmit duplicate
copies of the reports mentioned in Section 43, to
the Chief of Police every morning by or before 8
o'clock, with the names at full length of each and
every person taken into custody by the officers and
policemen ; also the time and cause of the arrest of
said persons, together with such matters of interest
as may be needful in the premises.
Sec. 10. They shall report to the Chief during
the day as often as circumstances may render it
necessary.
Sec. 11.
